Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: j s
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at your hotel. The facilities were magnificent, with all the unique and individual touches making all the difference. The room was so charming and elegant that it stands out against the typically generic and often dingy facilities/rooms. Furthermore, the pleasure we received and the memories we retain were greatly enhanced by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We need to extend particular gratitude to the concierge team who were invaluable as they listened well to exactly what we were seeking and then went above and beyond to ensure they came up with appropriate recommendations and then ensured we got into those venues. Needless to say, we would enthusiastically stay with you on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic magnificence”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: Out of this world experience. 3 days of shear heaven. Interiors that were stunningly beautiful. True 5 star quality in every respect. Staff were multilingual and totally professional. Dinner at the hotel outstanding cuisine and service "par excellance." Out the top drawer. Location perfect and so convenient. Wine selection impressive. Breakfast service - in room presentation average with the food which unfortunately was ice cold. Horribly disappointing. Expensive however worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but bedbugs?”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelor
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. My room was upgraded and was huge. I found the hotel to be close to the metro and was very convenient to the conference venue that I was visiting. The staff were fantastic and service great. My only issue was that I was bitten multiple times all over my body in bed one night. I informed hotel reception that I was concerned they might have bedbugs, but was reassured that this was unlikely. "perhaps Mosquitos" was the response. It was definitely not a flying insect. Something had crawled from my back, down over my buttocks, legs to feet, biting as it went. Now that I am home I have spent hours decontaminating my clothes and luggage to ensure that nothing has travelled home with me.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to comprehend...”
Reviews.Author: Alan_from_Ohtel
Reviews.Content: When I started to plan my first trip to Europe I was overwhelmed with the amount of information about this to do and places to see. I was planning a marriage proposal to my girl friend, and Paris seemed like the obvious place to plan the surprise. After emailing a couple of hotel restaurants for menus etc. I settled on the Saint James. Christian, the Concierge helped me plan not only a memorable dinner, but a wonderful night time tour of Paris by Limo with Champagne afterwards. Laurence the driver was a great host and his timing impeccable as we arrived to view the Eifel Tower just on 11pm as it lit up and I asked the big question...how could she resist ? ! As a Luxury Hotel owner in New Zealand, I was keen to experience something unusual, but traditional in Europe. I didn't stay as I was travelling with children, but can highly recommend the space, staff and restaurant - just wonderful, Thanks !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but... Had a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: PEF24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly beautiful. The concierge was so helpful. This was my first time in Paris and he helped us get around and told us all the great things to do that werent the typical Paris things (I.e. Eiffel tower). The garden is just amazing and the rooms are very spacious and well kept. This hotel was recently renovated so everything is new. Although we did have a few minor problems. On our second night the power went out in our room... And only our room. They could not figure out what was wrong so they moved us to another room. We didn't mind moving but at about 2am we had someone walk into the new room that we were staying in. It was quite frightening to wake up to. Especially when whoever walked in left the second they knew someone was in there and then the front desk could not explain why someone had a key and wondered into our room. Luckily the hotel was very nice about it and comped a night because of this. Other than that it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: becs1
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed two nights at the Saint James Paris. Our expectations were quite high since I also work in the travel industry and my friend is an interior designer. But the hotel was really stunning and we were both very very impressed. From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave everything is top notch. Upon arrival the voiturier parked the car and helped us bring in the luggage, the check-in goes very smooth and Laetitia the very nice lady at reception showed us around and gave us a bit of information about the building and the room. I was quite intrigued by all the hot air balloons on the wall paper and the balloon shaped lamps. Saint James was apparently the first place where hot air balloons went up in France. It also reflects on three balloon shaped pavillions which are being used as bar area when the weather is nice. We stayed in one of the suites and the room was very spacious and beautifully decorated. There's a lot of attention to detail and we could not fault anything. The metro-tiled bathroom with bathtub and separate shower were very relaxing after strolling through the streets of Paris. The hotel has a very convenient location, only at 15 minutes walking from the Champs-ElysÃ©es and there's a metro only a few steps from the hotel. We would like to thank Mr Monnin and his entire staff for the great hospitaliy they showed us. It is very rare to find this level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: Dad-O-Rama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Saint James or one night on business in November.The way I'd categorize it is nice but not great. The location is good but the decor is what a little tacky...very over the top. I think that's the look their going for. But it's not really my taste. Another reviewer called it a hotel that doesn't take itself too seriously. I think that's probably right. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the location was quiet. The rooms were very spacious. It really depends whether the style is to your liking. For 371 Euros, it wasn't bad, but I can't help feel that I could have had better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia V
Reviews.Content: I met my daughter, who is studying in Florence, for a 10 stay in Paris. I was originally a little hesitant about the St. James location but soon realized it was wonderful. I usually stay in the 1st or 2nd arrondissements. The St. James is close to wonderful restaurants, a vibrant neighborhood and public transportation. After long long days of walking through the lovely streets, experiencing incredible historic sites and lots of shopping, it was a treat to come "home" to our chateau. The decor is fantastic. Our suite was large and comfortable. The service - front desk, concierge, dining staff were very accommodating. Several times, after a long day, we just sat in the beautiful library and ordered dinner in a cozy informal atmosphere. The St. James put the icing on the cake to a dreamy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A grand Chateau that doesn't take itself too seriously”
Reviews.Author: solarbea
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning and, although the room was not ready, we enjoyed a lovely side-breakfast in the wood panelled bar. The hotel is beautiful, having undergone a recent re-development, and the room, a suite on the second floor, was excellent. It's also a beautiful part of Paris and walking out in a morning was a great way to start the day. This will be a regular Paris stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you have a great room, its great---go.if you are not sure of the exact room you are getting, it can be iffy.”
Reviews.Author: rb818
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely grand with the most exclusive type of backyard patio and restaurant. Unfortunately our room while well decorated was in the lower level. Yes, basement!!!! Not what I would expect for 600 a night. They were willing to change our room--this time to a highest floor modest motel like room with one small round window. ( This is in a hotel which appears to have 5 ft windows in the majority of rooms!) Upon complaint to jetsetter, we were upgraded to an extraordinary suite. I wish we did not have to go through the experience of complaining. We did not need the big suite-- a deluxe appropriate room from the get go would have been better by far. See iu you can get a great deal and make sure you see a photo of the actual room you will have. Too uneven an array for my taste. I would recommend it if you are careful about the room you accept. I should not have had to go through this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in every way.”
Reviews.Author: CarWhisperer
Reviews.Content: Generally my wife and I are budget travelers but when we decided to marry and honeymoon in Paris taking our hotel experience up a couple of notches seemed like the thing to do. After much research we decided to book at The Hotel Saint James in Paris. We were not disappointed in any way. From the moment we arrived the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our bed had rose petals arranged in a heart shape and a complimentary bottle of champagne awaited us. (If you are on you honeymoon make sure you advise the staff in advance). The sinks were both surrounded by rose petals and the room was spotless. Unlike many Parisian hotels the Saint James has lush grounds surrounding it and the back of the hotel has a wonderful and inviting veranda. Our room, 106, had been recently renovated and exceeded our wildest expectations. It is located on the garden level which might be a turn off to some people because of not having a view, but we found the absolute quiet to be the perfect trade-off. The walls of the room are finished with hand painted murals and the ceiling is fully arched, giving the impression of being in a wine cellar. The bathroom is nicely separated from the boudoir and the room was large by Parisian standards based on what I've seen in other reviews. The concierges went out of their way to help us book a hotel in Bayeux for our trip to Normandy and booked all of our train tickets and excursions as well. It may be some time before we can return to Paris but I am certain that when we return if we choose to stay in a hotel other than The Saint James we will be disappointed in comparison. I would gladly recommend the Saint James to anyone planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Special”
Reviews.Author: EuroTrav2011
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel in Paris, I felt like staying in a little place. It was very classic starting from the lobby going up the stairs or may be using the old elevator; the rooms were very classic including the key. the restaurant look like an old library and it is full of books, the view to the garden was very special for lunch or early dinner I would highly recommend if you are looking for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden castle in Paris - not to miss”
Reviews.Author: sunnynel
Reviews.Content: What a superb hotel. I myself work in hospitality and have stayed in numerous hotels around the world but the Saint James is really a gem, very unique. The decoration is fabulous, mix of modern and classic, not to mention the staff that is very attentive and pleasant, especially Jeremy from the front desk. Beautiful gardens, I think it would be a wonderful place for cocktail, even weddings. I stayed there for business but would definitely stay again with my husband. It is very quiet and 5mn walk from the metro. will be back!

Reviews.Title: “You have not lived until you have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: foolsnotsuffered
Reviews.Content: Ok. This sounds like a big claim but let me tell you I am pretty well travelled and have stayed in a. Number of 'luxury' hotels around the world but there is something special about this place. Firstly the staff are superb without being overbearing. Then the rooms come into play. These have been refurbished by a designer with a strong sense of both Anglo Franco sensibilities and fun. It is a delightful place to be. Better than all of this is its location. Close to everything but away from the madding crowd. My top tip would be don't eat dinner there but ask the supremely competent concierge staff for a recommendation and if your french is lacking a booking. They all speak perfect english. heaven in nirvana. What more could you want. It is a delight to all the senses. Stay here if you can. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem”
Reviews.Author: serial2urist
Reviews.Content: saint james is one of the most special hotels i ever stayed..the building itself is a thing of beauty, nicely restored and with very tastefully decoration ,!we arrived late in the evening and were offered 2 horrible rooms on the 3rd floor, with very old carpeting,which we changed next morning to beautiful refurbished rooms, which was better since i am allergic! breakfast is nicely served by waiters to the host s table and the ingredients are first quality , but level f service may vary from very attentive -first day- to almost rude -third day! the garden is lovely and well worth a drink in the evening! i did not have the chance to try the spa, the location is ok good but not great ,but overall lovely experience! stay at saint james s you wiil just love it

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular as always”
Reviews.Author: Clancz
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful staff and an unexpected renovation

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: karyn1241
Reviews.Content: my teenage daughter and i just returned from a 6 day stay in paris.the Saint James was just lovely.the room was large and charming.the staff--particularly the concierges and specifically Christian--were unbelievably helpful.whether it was explaining how to get to a museum or finding a restaurant or getting concert tickets--they were just great.i would highly recommend this hotel for it's great service,charming rooms and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: LizMcLure
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The building and courtyard are gorgeous, and the interior makes you feel like you stepped into an old world mansion. The study/bar is unique and welcoming with bookshelves of antique books adding to the ambiance. The grand staircase and elegant lobby were beautiful, and our room had a quirky "haunted mansion" feel to it that was so much fun. We stayed in a standard room, and there were portraits on the walls and chandeleirs above the bed. Speaking to another couple, we learned that each room is decorated a little differently, and I'd imagine they are all equally fantastic. The hotel was expensive, and I would normally not spend so much on a room, but I can definitively say that it was worth the cost. For the few days that we were in Paris we were treated to wonderful service and uniquely amazing accomodations. The hotel is also in close proximity to decent dining, subway entrances, and depending on how ambitious you are, walking distance to all the major sites. Though I wouldn't necessary recommend it, my husband and I were able to take the subway to Notre Dame and walk all the way back to the hotel. Sites along the way during our walk included the Louvre, Museum d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, and Arc de Triomphe. This hotel is a true find, and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: christalynne
Reviews.Content: The Saint James is absolutely amazing. I've been to Paris many, many times but this is the most romantic amazing hotel I'Ve ever seen. It looks like a gorgeous old mansion and has a very beautiful private courtyard and amaying fountain in front. Rates very reasonable for such a fancy hotel. Rooms beautiful red print cloth walls - its just stunning! Also just one minute away from the beautiful Parc Boulogne. It has a lovely lake to walk or run around, many trails, natural beauty in the midst of busy Paris. I really recommend it! Would be perfect for a honeymoon or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for my first trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: adinaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, not far from the city center. I booked this small hotel through Small Luxury Hotels of the world, and was kindly given a very nice upgrade to a large room on the top floor. My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary, which I let them know when I made the reservation, and they said "Happy Anniversary" upon check-in....The Saint James was undergoing some renovations while we where there, which gave a new modern vibe to the elegant 100 year old Chateau-style hotel. They have new furniture in the entry and dinning room, bold red and black design with a turn of the century style mixed with a edge....Loved the Library Bar which was receiving new carpet the day we arrived but was up and running by the next day. Breakfast was served outside on the restaurant terrace who's only fault was you could not see out of . You are in a tent while eating, they should open up a few walls to view a garden. The entrance to the hotel is grand behind walls, makes you feel like you have a special place to come home to after a long day...and the staff treats you the same way. Very nice, I would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “The St. James Club mirrors the best of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: KingsRogue
Reviews.Content: Paris is busy but the St. James Club is a haven for your soul. Nothing beats returning to this â€œgemâ€� after a busy day in Paris. If there is something more you need to love Paris the St. James Club might be just the ticket. Staying here is like being a member of a very small and discreet club-as the name implies. Not a place to be people watching because most everyone here are busy and doing their own thing but if you just want to have a safe and peaceful place to call home in Parisâ€”this is it!

Reviews.Title: “unique, sophisticated, superb”
Reviews.Author: Streetfeeds
Reviews.Content: I only stay in world class hotels. This was one of the best I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with large rooms, stunning service & grounds”
Reviews.Author: travellingclarkes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the advice of friends who had previously stayed with their two young children. Thank goodness we took her advice. Beautiful old chateau, tastefully restored & maintained, with impeccable attention to service and impressive sized suites. Food was excellent, which cd be taken in room, in the restaurant or out in the summer marquee.Nothing was a problem for our concierge who went to great lengths to help us with complex train travel after our stay. Gorgeous little stores & restaurants/boulangerie within walking distance of the hotel, and there is a st james smart car avail to hire for those wanting to venture further away. Would be hard pressed to find something equivalent in quality and service for the price in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Private, quite, and yet close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Clancz
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with a fantastic staff. They were a great help with maps, directions, reservations, etc. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Calm amongst the Chaos”
Reviews.Author: ShirTuck2001
Reviews.Content: The Saint James is a beautiful haven away from the crowds and hectic pace of Paris. Set majestically in its gardens with tier fountain, it's hard to believe you are only a short walk away from all the major attractions. The suites are well apppointed and windows open to the sights and sounds of the little streets below. If you are travelling to Paris, don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience/location”
Reviews.Author: radlettfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It was well priced and walking distance to all the top sites. You are opposite the louvre park with playgrounds donkey rides. The hotel has a beautiful heated pool and gym. Not many hotels offer this. We had a lovely time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ganks
Reviews.Content: The Saint James Paris is an amazing hotel in a gorgeous, park-like setting. We stayed in a junior suite on the 5th floor and it was HUGE. The room opened onto an area with a table, powder room and mini bar. There were stairs down to a sunken living room with a flat screen TV, CD stereo, 2 couches, a coffee table and a very cool skylight that opened electronically. Down a long hall on the main level was the bedroom and marble bathroom with double sinks. The rack rate on this room was 630 Euros/night (!!!), but we got an amazing deal at 280 Euros due to us being transferred from a sister hotel that closed for the summer because of unexpected maintenance. My parents stayed in a full suite and it was even better than our room. The first level had a giagantic living room with all the amenities and a powder room. Up a full flight of stairs they had a master bedroom and bathroom that was the full size of the living room. The living room was on the ground floor of the hotel and looked out into the main courtyard and fountain at the front of the hotel. This was possibly the nicest room in the hotel. I would highly recommend staying at the Saint James. The only drawback is that the rooms are very expensive, and if you can get past the cost, it is well worth the price. The staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful. All of the rooms and common areas were very clean and well presented. The hotel was very conveniently located near two Metro stops (Port Dauphine and Victor Hugo.) All-in-all we had a fantastic 3 nights at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best I've stayed in in Paris, by far”
Reviews.Author: ricepudding21
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take friends for a weekend break from London and as is often the case, was worried that they would either be (a) tiny (b) noisy (c) miles away (d) if central, pleasant and roomy, then fantastically expensive, pretentious etc. as I've often found. The Saint James was for me and my friends a terrific surprise. It looks a bit out of the way on the map but it's 10 minutes walk from the Trocadero and Etoile, and 2 minutes from a metro (line 2). Very peaceful. Very friendly indeed. Gracious, impressive and above all - roomy. We had two top floor rooms which were reasonably expensive but nothing like what I saw advertised closer in at the usual grand places. Very comfortable, large and peaceful. It is slightly old fashioned but that suits me very well indeed. No snooty staff in black, no clouds of perfume or loud lounge music. I found it very pleasant to walk a few blocks to get to shops, sights, metro etc. and loved the peaceful neigbhbourhood. I think this is the best hotel in Paris - by a mile. It has transformed my experience of the city! I used to dread booking there either for discomfort or amazing cost - now ... well, I sound like an advertisement. Special mention should go to the extremely friendly and helpful staff - especially in a city rightly famous for poor service. Well done. I will be back many times.

HotelInfo.Name: Saint James Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 43 avenue Bugeaud, 75116 Paris, France
